TempSED 0.0
  • Get started
  • Reference

    Properties of the bulk sediment.

    bulk_properties.Rd

    Calculates the density (bulk_density), specific heat capacity (bulk_cp), thermal conductivity ( bulk_tc), and thermal diffusivity (bulk_td) of the bulk sediment.

    bulk_properties calculates all these properties.

    bulk_properties(density_water = 1024, density_solid = 2500,  cp_water = 3994, 
                cp_solid = 1000, td_water = 1.4e-07, td_solid = 2e-06, 
                tc_water = 0.6, tc_solid = 2.0, porosity = 0.5)

bulk_density (density_water = 1024, density_solid = 2500, porosity = 0.5)

bulk_tc (tc_water = 0.6, tc_solid = 2.0, porosity = 0.5)

bulk_cp (density_water = 1024, density_solid = 2500, cp_water = 3994, 
         cp_solid = 1000, porosity = 0.5)

bulk_td (density_water = 1024, density_solid = 2500, cp_water = 3994, 
         cp_solid = 1000, td_water = 1.4e-07, td_solid = 2e-06, 
         porosity = 0.5)

    Arguments

    porosity

    volumetric water content (volume water/volume bulk), [-].

    density_water, density_solid

    Water density (density_water) and sediment dry density (density_solid); [kg/m3], one value.

    cp_water, cp_solid

    Specific heat capacity of the water (cp_water) and of solid sediment (cp_solid) [J/kg/dgC], one value.

    td_water, td_solid

    The thermal diffusivity of the water (td_water) and of the solid sediment (td_solid) [m2/s] (the "diffusion coefficient" for temperature), one value.

    tc_water, tc_solid

    The thermal conductivity of the water (tc_water) and of the solid sediment (tc_solid) [W/m/dg], one value.

    Value

    function bulkProperties returns a list with:

    • density_bulk, the density of the bulk sediment, [kg/m3], as many values as length of porosity.

    • cp_bulk, the specific heat capacity of the bulk sediment [J/kg/dgC], length of porosity.

    • td_bulk, the thermal diffusivity of the bulk sediment, [m2/s], length of porosity.

    • tc_bulk, the thermal conductivity of the bulk sediment, [W/m/s], length of porosity.

    function bulk_density returns a vector with the density of the bulk sediment, [kg/m3], as many values as length of porosity.

    function bulk_cp returns a vector with the specific heat capacity of the bulk sediment [J/kg/dgC], as many values as length of porosity.

    function bulk_td returns a vector with the thermal diffusivity of the bulk sediment, [m2/s], as many values as length of porosity.

    function bulk_tc returns a vector with the thermal conductivity of the bulk sediment, [W/m/s], as many values as length of porosity.

    The object attributes contain:

    • A description of these variables, including their units.

    • the input parameter settings.

    use attibutes(object)$description and attibutes(object)$parameters to extract it.

    Author

    Karline Soetaert

    Details

    See vignette("TempSED") for a description of the formulations used.

    References

    Shusaku Goto, Makoto Yamano, Sumito Morita, Toshiya Kanamatsu, Akihiro Hachikubo, Satsuki Kataoka, Manabu Tanahashi, Ryo Matsumoto, 2017. Physical and thermal properties of mud-dominant sediment from the Joetsu Basin in the eastern margin of the Japan Sea. Mar Geophys Res 38:393-407, DOI 10.1007/s11001-017-9302-y

    See also

    air_properties. water_properties. mineral_properties. flux_heat.

    Examples

    
# ---------------------------------------------------------
# The defaults
# ---------------------------------------------------------

 bulk_properties()
#>   density_bulk  cp_bulk      td_bulk  tc_bulk
#> 1         1762 1869.993 5.135197e-07 1.095445
 bulk_density()
#> [1] 1762
#> attr(,"description")
#>          names  description units
#> 1 density_bulk bulk density kg/m3
#> attr(,"parameters")
#>           names mean.values      description units
#> 1 density_water      1024.0 density of water kg/m3
#> 2 density_solid      2500.0 density of solid kg/m3
#> 9      porosity         0.5         porosity     -
 as.vector(bulk_density())
#> [1] 1762
 
 attributes(bulk_properties())
#> $names
#> [1] "density_bulk" "cp_bulk"      "td_bulk"      "tc_bulk"     
#> 
#> $row.names
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> $class
#> [1] "data.frame"
#> 
#> $description
#>          names                 description   units
#> 1 density_bulk                bulk density   kg/m3
#> 2      cp_bulk bulk specific heat capacity J/kg/dg
#> 3      td_bulk    bulk thermal diffusivity    m2/s
#> 4      tc_bulk   bulk thermal conductivity   W/m/s
#> 
#> $parameters
#>           names mean.values                     description   units
#> 1 density_water   1.024e+03                density of water   kg/m3
#> 2 density_solid   2.500e+03                density of solid   kg/m3
#> 3      cp_water   3.994e+03 specific heat capacity of water J/kg/dg
#> 4      cp_solid   1.000e+03 specific heat capacity of solid J/kg/dg
#> 5      td_water   1.400e-07    thermal diffusivity of water    m2/s
#> 6      td_solid   2.000e-06    thermal diffusivity of solid    m2/s
#> 7      tc_water   6.000e-01   thermal conductivity of water  W/K/dg
#> 8      tc_solid   2.000e+00   thermal conductivity of solid  W/K/dg
#> 9      porosity   5.000e-01                        porosity       -
#> 
 
# ---------------------------------------------------------
# range of parameters
# ---------------------------------------------------------

 por.seq  <- seq(from = 1, to = 0.5, length.out = 10)
 
 BP.por   <- bulk_properties(por = por.seq)
 BP.por
#>    density_bulk  cp_bulk      td_bulk   tc_bulk
#> 1          1024 3994.000 1.400000e-07 0.6000000
#> 2          1106 3618.020 1.613969e-07 0.6415050
#> 3          1188 3293.944 1.861546e-07 0.6858812
#> 4          1270 3011.717 2.148196e-07 0.7333271
#> 5          1352 2763.724 2.480308e-07 0.7840550
#> 6          1434 2544.093 2.865365e-07 0.8382920
#> 7          1516 2348.222 3.312143e-07 0.8962809
#> 8          1598 2172.452 3.830942e-07 0.9582812
#> 9          1680 2013.841 4.433873e-07 1.0245704
#> 10         1762 1869.993 5.135197e-07 1.0954451

#> $names
#> [1] "density_bulk" "cp_bulk"      "td_bulk"      "tc_bulk"     
#>

#> 4      tc_bulk   bulk thermal conductivity   W/m/s

#>           names mean.values                     description   units

#> 2 density_solid   2.500e+03                density of solid   kg/m3
#> 3      cp_water   3.994e+03 specific heat capacity of water J/kg/dg
#> 4      cp_solid   1.000e+03 specific heat capacity of solid J/kg/dg
#> 5      td_water   1.400e-07    thermal diffusivity of water    m2/s

#> 7      tc_water   6.000e-01   thermal conductivity of water  W/K/dg
#> 8      tc_solid   2.000e+00   thermal conductivity of solid  W/K/dg
#> 9      porosity   7.500e-01                        porosity       -
#> 

 CP.por  <- bulk_cp(por = por.seq)
 CP.por
#>  [1] 3994.000 3618.020 3293.944 3011.717 2763.724 2544.093 2348.222 2172.452
#>  [9] 2013.841 1869.993
#> attr(,"description")
#> [1] names       description units      
#> <0 rows> (or 0-length row.names)
#> attr(,"parameters")
#>           names mean.values                     description   units
#> 1 density_water     1024.00                density of water   kg/m3
#> 2 density_solid     2500.00                density of solid   kg/m3
#> 3      cp_water     3994.00 specific heat capacity of water J/kg/dg
#> 4      cp_solid     1000.00 specific heat capacity of solid J/kg/dg
#> 9      porosity        0.75                        porosity       -
 attributes(CP.por)
#> $description
#> [1] names       description units      
#> <0 rows> (or 0-length row.names)
#> 
#> $parameters
#>           names mean.values                     description   units
#> 1 density_water     1024.00                density of water   kg/m3
#> 2 density_solid     2500.00                density of solid   kg/m3
#> 3      cp_water     3994.00 specific heat capacity of water J/kg/dg
#> 4      cp_solid     1000.00 specific heat capacity of solid J/kg/dg
#> 9      porosity        0.75                        porosity       -
#> 

 cps.seq <- seq(from = 400, to = 2000, length.out = 100)
 BP.cps  <- bulk_properties(cp_solid = cps.seq)
 head(BP.cps)
#>   density_bulk   cpBulk      td_bulk  tc_bulk
#> 1         1762 1444.341 4.204918e-07 1.095445
#> 2         1762 1455.806 4.255246e-07 1.095445
#> 3         1762 1467.271 4.303195e-07 1.095445
#> 4         1762 1478.737 4.348907e-07 1.095445
#> 5         1762 1490.202 4.392515e-07 1.095445
#> 6         1762 1501.667 4.434138e-07 1.095445
 
 attributes(BP.cps)$description
#>          names                 description   units
#> 1 density_bulk                bulk density   kg/m3
#> 2      cp_bulk bulk specific heat capacity J/kg/dg
#> 3      td_bulk    bulk thermal diffusivity    m2/s
#> 4      tc_bulk   bulk thermal conductivity   W/m/s

# ---------------------------------------------------------
# realistic porosity profile
# ---------------------------------------------------------

x <- seq(0, 0.3, length.out=100)

# a function to estimate porosity

p.exp <- function (x,                      # depth
                   y.0 = 0.9, y.inf = 0.5, # porosity at upper and lower boundary
                   x.att = 0.01)           # attenuation coefficient
                   
    return(y.inf + (y.0 - y.inf) * exp(-x/x.att))

por.seq <- p.exp(x)
BP      <- bulk_properties(por = por.seq)

par(mfrow = c(1,4), las = 1)
plot(por.seq, x*100, 
     type = "l", ylim = c(30, 0), 
     xlab = "-", ylab = "cm", main = "sediment porosity")
     
plot(BP$density_bulk, x*100, 
     type = "l", ylim = c(30, 0), 
     xlab = "kg/m3", ylab = "cm", main = "bulk density")
     
plot(BP$cp_bulk, x*100, 
     type = "l", ylim = c(30, 0), 
     xlab = "J/kg/dg", ylab = "cm", main = "bulk heat capacity")
     
plot(BP$td_bulk, x*100, 
     type = "l", ylim = c(30, 0), 
     xlab = "m2/s", ylab = "cm", main="bulk thermal diffusivity")
